com.Briggeman.Tuples

Class Tuple

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.Briggeman.Tuples.Tuple
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable

    public class Tuple
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable
    This class builds nested pairs for up to 5 arguments. After that you must make separate tuples and use tupleCat(). The relationship between tuples and pairs is aggregate.

      • tupleCat

        public void tupleCat(Tuple tupleB)
        Concatenates tuple to current.
        Parameters:
        tupleB - Tuple that will append to current.

      • iterator

        public TupleIterator iterator()
        This returns an iterator over the current tuple. Works just like an iterator over standard collections. Keep in mind that this is an Iterator over Pairs, not the individual values. You will have to take into consideration what your code will need to do when the iterator hits the last pair.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable
